foreignNames.name: Izoni, la del Millar de Ojos

cards.name: Izoni, Thousand-Eyed
cards.originalText:
Undergrowth — When Izoni, Thousand-Eyed enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 black and green Insect creature token for each creature card in your graveyard.
{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: You gain 1 life and draw a card.

rulings.text: You can activate Izoni's last ability while its undergrowth ability is on the stack. This will increase the number of Insect tokens you'll create.
Creature cards with other types, such as artifact creature cards, count for undergrowth abilities.
Because tokens aren't cards, they never count for undergrowth abilities.

cards.text:
Undergrowth — When Izoni, Thousand-Eyed enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 black and green Insect creature token for each creature card in your graveyard.
{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: You gain 1 life and draw a card.

cards.name: Darkblast
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.flavor: The outskirts of Golgari territory are guarded by more than just walls.

foreignNames.name: 貧民街の刈り取るもの

cards.name: Slum Reaper
cards.originalText: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Slum Reaper itself. If you control no other creatures, you'll have to sacrifice Slum Reaper.

cards.text: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Stinkweed Imp
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
Notably, Stinkweed Imp's ability isn't deathtouch. It's a triggered ability that triggers only on combat damage.

cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.flavor: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.
cards.name: Vigor Mortis
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counter from this ability is in addition to any other counters the creature enters the battlefield with.

cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Some Golgari insects live for centuries—and they never stop growing.
cards.name: Deadbridge Goliath
cards.originalText: Scavenge {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: Exiling the creature card with scavenge is part of the cost of activating the scavenge ability. Once the ability is activated and the cost is paid, it's too late to stop the ability from being activated by trying to remove the creature card from the graveyard.

cards.text: Scavenge {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.
cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B}. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.

cards.flavor: The Izzet quickly suspended their policy of lifetime guarantees.
cards.name: Abrupt Decay
cards.originalText:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy target nonland permanent with converted mana cost 3 or less.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of a creature token is 0, unless that token is a copy of another creature, in which case it copies that creature's mana cost.
If a permanent has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy target nonland permanent with converted mana cost 3 or less.

cards.name: Deadbridge Chant
cards.originalText:
When Deadbridge Chant enters the battlefield, put the top ten cards of your library into your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

rulings.text: The card is chosen at random as the ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be chosen.
Because the last ability doesn't target any card in your graveyard, any card put into your graveyard in response to the ability may be chosen.

Each card in your graveyard must have an equal chance of being chosen. Assigning them each a number and rolling a die is an easy way to do this. In formats that allow you to rearrange your graveyard—including Standard, Modern, and Return to Ravnica block Limited formats, you may also shuffle your graveyard face down and choose a card at random.

cards.text:
When Deadbridge Chant enters the battlefield, put the top ten cards of your library into your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Deathrite Shaman
cards.originalText:
{T}: Exile target land card from a graveyard. Add one mana of any color.
{B}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from a graveyard. Each opponent loses 2 life.
{G}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.

rulings.text: Because the first ability requires a target, it is not a mana ability. It uses the stack and can be responded to.

If the target of any of Deathrite Shaman's three abilities is an illegal target when that ability tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't add mana to your mana pool, no opponent will lose life, or you won't gain life, as appropriate.

cards.text:
{T}: Exile target land card from a graveyard. Add one mana of any color.
{B}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from a graveyard. Each opponent loses 2 life.
{G}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: The rot farmer's first rite of passage is to craft a pair of work stilts.
cards.name: Drown in Filth
cards.originalText: Choose target creature. Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard, then that creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each land card in your graveyard.

rulings.text: You choose the target of Drown in Filth as you cast the spell. You won't necessarily know what will happen to that creature's power and toughness at that time.

cards.text: Choose target creature. Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard, then that creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each land card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Golgari reclaimers resent the gorgons, begrudging the loss of so many fine nutrients locked away in stone.
cards.name: Gaze of Granite
cards.originalText: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost X or less.

rulings.text: If a permanent has {X} in its mana cost, the value of that X is 0.
The converted mana cost of a creature token is 0 unless that token is a copy of another creature, in which case it copies that creature's mana cost.

cards.text: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.flavor:
"Let the rest of Ravnica sneer. One way or another, they all end up in the undercity."
—Jarad
cards.name: Golgari Charm
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Regenerate each creature you control.

cards.name: Grave-Shell Scarab
cards.originalText:
{1}, Sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab: Draw a card.
Dredge 1 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly one card from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: You may sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab to pay for its first ability, then replace that draw using the Scarab's dredge ability. The result is that the top card of your library is put into your graveyard and Grave-Shell Scarab returns to your hand (after a brief trip to the graveyard).

cards.text:
{1}, Sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab: Draw a card.
Dredge 1 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly one card from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.flavor: To the Golgari, anything buried is treasure.
cards.name: Grisly Salvage
cards.originalText: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの死者の王、ジャラド

cards.name: Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord
cards.originalText:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Jarad's first ability applies only when Jarad is on the battlefield.
The life loss is based on the power of the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

To activate Jarad's last ability, you must sacrifice two lands. It doesn't matter what other land types the two lands have, as long as one is a Swamp and one is a Forest. Even if one of the lands you sacrifice is both a Swamp and a Forest, you have to sacrifice another land that is a Swamp or a Forest.
You can sacrifice any land with the land type Swamp or Forest, not just ones named Swamp or Forest. For example, you could sacrifice two Overgrown Tombs.

cards.text:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

foreignNames.name: コロズダのギルド魔道士

cards.name: Korozda Guildmage
cards.originalText:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Use the sacrificed creature's toughness when it was last on the battlefield to determine the value of X.

cards.text:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.flavor: He lurks in the undercity, eager for the corpse haulers to unload their rotting cargo.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Discard a creature card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Lotleth Troll.
{B}: Regenerate Lotleth Troll.
cards.text:
Trample
Discard a creature card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Lotleth Troll.
{B}: Regenerate Lotleth Troll.

cards.flavor:
"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer
cards.name: Putrefy
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: "Nature's most raw beauty is the circle: perfect in its continuance, with no break between death and life."

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの女王、サヴラ

cards.name: Savra, Queen of the Golgari
cards.originalText:
Whenever you sacrifice a black creature, you may pay 2 life. If you do, each other player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever you sacrifice a green creature, you may gain 2 life.

rulings.text: These abilities trigger specifically when you "sacrifice" a creature. They won't trigger when a creature is put into your graveyard for any other reason.
Savra itself doesn't let you sacrifice creatures, and you can't sacrifice them spontaneously. You must have another spell or ability that lets you sacrifice creatures.
Sacrificing a creature that's both black and green will make both abilities trigger. You may put them on the stack in whichever order you want.

cards.text:
Whenever you sacrifice a black creature, you may pay 2 life. If you do, each other player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever you sacrifice a green creature, you may gain 2 life.

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Sisters of Stone Death
cards.originalText:
{G}: Target creature blocks Sisters of Stone Death this turn if able.
{B}{G}: Exile target creature blocking or blocked by Sisters of Stone Death.
{2}{B}: Put a creature card exiled with Sisters of Stone Death onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: The third ability can get back any creature card exiled by the second ability, no matter when it was exiled. If a card that's not a creature card (such as Svogthos, the Restless Tomb) was exiled, the third ability can't return it.

cards.text:
{G}: Target creature blocks Sisters of Stone Death this turn if able.
{B}{G}: Exile target creature blocking or blocked by Sisters of Stone Death.
{2}{B}: Put a creature card exiled with Sisters of Stone Death onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Treasured Find.
